title: Venezuela Oil Tanker Seized by U.S. Was Part of Effort to Finance Cuba
summary: Firms with ties to Cuba are getting a larger share of Venezuelan oil exports, as the island’s security agents boost President Nicolás Maduro’s defenses.

title: Behind the Venezuelan Opposition Leader’s Daring Escape to Oslo
summary: An American firm with experience in special operations spirited María Corina Machado, the recipient of the Nobel Peace Prize, out of the country in a secretive land, sea and air operation.

title: For Rubio the Cuba Hawk, the Road to Havana Runs Through Venezuela
summary: President Trump’s secretary of state and national security adviser has long sought to cripple or topple Cuba’s government, which has close security and economic ties to Venezuela.

title: In Trump’s Justice Dept., Failing in Court Might Be Better Than Bucking the Boss
summary: Thursday demonstrated an emerging reality for President Trump: Commanding the Justice Department is not the same as controlling the justice system.

title: Judge’s Order Complicates Justice Dept. Plans to Again Charge Comey
summary: Justice Department officials have been considering whether to bring new charges against James B. Comey, the former F.B.I. director, after a different judge dismissed the original case against him.

title: Amid Fractures on the Right, Tucker Carlson Continues His Attacks
summary: On Theo Von’s show this week, Mr. Carlson lashed out at a major supporter of the president, the F.B.I. and “unimpressive, dumb, totally noncreative people” leading the nation.

title: Colorado Officials Reject Trump’s ‘Pardon’ of a Convicted Election Denier
summary: The president’s stated intention to pardon Tina Peters, jailed for tampering with election machines in 2020, has set off a legal fight over the extent of Mr. Trump’s pardon powers.

title: Biden Has Raised Little of What He Needs to Build a Presidential Library
summary: His library foundation has told the I.R.S. that by the end of 2027 it expects to bring in just $11.3 million — not nearly enough for a traditional presidential library.

title: Eric Adams Swaggered Into City Hall, and Now He’s Swaggering Out
summary: Interviewed as he prepares to leave office, Mayor Eric Adams said that he hadn’t gotten the credit he deserved and that certain forces had always been arrayed against him.

title: Clean, Limitless Energy Exists. China Is Going Big in the Race to Harness It.
summary: Beijing is pouring vast resources into fusion research, while the U.S. wants private industry to lead the way. The winner could reshape civilization.

title: The Reasonable Majority Is No Longer Silent
summary: Donald Trump is confronting a backlash of the reasonable.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Valued at $800 Billion, as It Prepares to Go Public
summary: A sale of insider shares at $421 a share would make Mr. Musk’s rocket company the most valuable private company in the world, as it readies for a possible initial public offering next year.

title: Can Trump’s Grand Plans for Gaza Get Off the Drawing Board?
summary: The next steps for the president’s 20-point Gaza peace plan have been mired in uncertainty and a lack of detail, but that may be set to change. Here’s what to know.

title: A Measles Outbreak Brings With It Echoes of the Pandemic
summary: In South Carolina, parents struggle to deal with infections that have brought quarantines and remote learning. Health care workers are bracing for an increase in cases.

title: Record Flooding Swamps Western Washington
summary: Gov. Bob Ferguson and other state officials cautioned that more rainfall was expected after rivers hit record flood levels across the region, while residents worried about the long-term future.
